message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE

This paper deals with machine translation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a method to align segments across comparable bilingual articles, which involves some level of artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.AI a likely category as well. The paper also uses multi-task sequence-to-sequence models, which are a type of deep learning model, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. The paper also deals with information retrieval (IR) as it aims to simplify text for different levels of target language proficiency. Finally, the paper uses neural networks, which are a type of computational model, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible category as well.
